id.title: ID (hex)
id.description: ID of message in hex. Example: 1FF.

byteorder.title: Signal byteorder
byteorder.description: Can be Motorola (big endian) or Intel (little endian)

type.title: Type
type.description: Action on match, accept or reject message.

id_format.title: ID format
id_format.description: Filter ID format. Filters apply to messages with matching ID format.

f1.title: From (range) / ID (mask) (HEX)
f1.description: If filter method is Range, this field defines the start of range. If filter method is Mask, this field defines the filter ID.

f2.title: To (range) / mask (mask) (HEX)
f2.description: If filter method is Range, this field defines the end of range. If filter method is Mask, this field defines the filter mask.

prescaler_type.title: Prescaling type
prescaler_type.description: Select prescaling type. Prescale by message count, time or data. Select None to disable prescaling.

prescaler_value.title: Count
prescaler_value.description: Count prescaler value. Example: Set to 2 to sample a message with a specific ID every second time.

prescaler_value.title: Time
prescaler_value.description: Time prescaler value in milliseconds. Example: Set to 1000 to sample a message with a specific ID with a minimum period time of 1 second. Note that messages are not resampled to a specific fixed period time.

prescaler_value.title: Mask
prescaler_value.description: Data prescaler mask value in hex. Each bit corresponds to a data byte (up to 64 bytes). Leave empty to disable the mask (triggers on any data change). Example 1: Set to FF (0b11111111) to sample a message with a specific ID if any of the first 8 data bytes change. Example 2: Set to 03 (0b00000011) to sample if any of the two first data bytes change. Example 3: Set to 9 (0b00001001) to sample if any of the first or fourth data bytes change.

rx_state.title: Reception (rx) initial state
rx_state.description: The initial state of CAN-bus reception. Can be changed using the control signal.

tx_state.title: Transmission (tx) initial state
tx_state.description: The initial state of CAN-bus transmissions. Can be changed using the control signal.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Device CAN bus mode. Configures how the device interacts with the bus. In Normal mode, the device can receive, acknowledge and transmit frames. In Restricted mode, the device can receive and acknowledge, but not transmit frames. In Bus Monitoring mode, the device can receive, but not acknowledge or transmit frames. It is recommended to always use the most restrictive mode possible.

retransmission.title: Automatic retransmission
retransmission.description: Retransmission of frames that have lost arbitration or that have been disturbed by errors during transmission.

fd_spec.title: CAN FD specification
fd_spec.description: Configures the CAN FD specification used by the device. Shall match the specification used by the CAN bus network.

bit_rate_cfg_mode.title: Bit-rate configuration mode
bit_rate_cfg_mode.description: Configures how the CAN bus bit-rate is set. Modes Auto-detect and Bit-rate support all standard bit-rates. Non-standard bit-rate configuration can be set using Bit-timing. It is recommended to set the bit-rate manually if it is known.

remote_frames.title: Filter remote request frames
remote_frames.description: Controls if remote request frames are forwarded to the message filters. If `Reject` is selected, remote request frames are discarded before they reach the message filters.

id.description: Filters are checked sequentially, execution stops with the first matching filter element. Max 128 11-bit filters and 64 29-bit filters.

transmit.title: Transmit messages
transmit.description: List of CAN bus messages transmitted by the device. Requires a CAN-bus physical mode supporting transmissions.

id_format.title: ID Format
id_format.description: ID format of the transmit message.

frame_format.title: Frame format
frame_format.description: Frame format of the transmit message.

brs.title: Bit-Rate Switch
brs.description: Determines if an FD message is transmitted using a switched bit-rate.

log.title: Include in log
log.description: Determines if the transmitted message is included in the log file.

period.title: Period (10 ms steps)
period.description: Time period of the message transmission. 0: single shot, >0: periodic. Unit is ms.

delay.title: Delay (10 ms steps)
delay.description: Offset message within the period or delay a single shot message. If multiple messages are transmitted by the device, it is recommended to offset each separately to reduce peak load on bus. If period > 0, delay < period. If single-shot, delay can be up to max value. Unit is ms.

id.title: Message ID (hex)
id.description: ID of message to transmit in hex. Example: 1FF.

data.title: Messages Data (hex)
data.description: Data bytes of message to transmit. RTR frames only use the number of bytes do determine the DLC. Example: 01020304 or 0102030405060708.

heartbeat.title: Heartbeat
heartbeat.description: Periodic heartbeat (1 second period time). Requires a CAN-bus physical mode supporting transmissions.

state.title: State
state.description: Enable to periodically transmit heartbeat signal.

id.title: ID (hex)
id.description: ID of heartbeat message in hex. Example: 1FF.

frames.title: LIN frames
frames.description: Custom description of the frames on the network, if not using automatic length and/or checksum.

id.title: Frame ID (hex)
id.description: ID of frame in hex. Example: 0F.

length.title: Frame Length (decimal)
length.description: Length of the frame in decimal.

checksum_type.title: Checksum Type
checksum_type.description: Type of the checksum used on the LIN frame.

transmit.title: LIN transmit list
transmit.description: List of frames to transmit when in master mode.

id.description: Unique ID of frame in hex (an ID may only occur once in the list). Example: 0F.
ID of frame in hex. Example: 0F.

data.description: If more than zero data bytes, then the transmit is a PUBLISH frame. If zero data bytes, then the transmit is a SUBSCRIBE frame expecting a subscriber node to provide data.

period.title: Period (10 ms steps)
period.description: Time period of the message transmission. 0: single shot, >0: periodic. Unit is ms.

delay.title: Delay (10 ms steps)
delay.description: Offset message within the period or delay a single shot message. If multiple messages are transmitted by the device, it is recommended to offset each separately to reduce peak load on bus. If period > 0, delay < period. If single-shot, delay can be up to max value. Unit is ms.

rtc_tolerance.title: Time synchronization tolerance
rtc_tolerance.description: If the time difference exceeds the tolerance, the internal time is abruptly updated. The unit is seconds.

meta.title: Meta data
meta.description: Optional meta data string. Displayed in device file and log file headers. Example: Site1; Truck4; ConfigRev12

kpub.title: Server public key
kpub.description: Server / user ECC public key in base64 format. Shall match the encryption used for all protected fields.

debug.title: Debug
debug.description: Debug functionality for use during installation and troubleshooting.

syslog.title: System log
syslog.description: System events logged to the SD-card. The log levels are listed in order of increasing amount of information logged. Should only be enabled if needed during installation or troubleshooting.

split_size.title: File split size (1 to 512 MB)
split_size.description: Log file split size in MB. When the file split size is reached a new file is created and the logging continues. Closed log files can be pushed to a server if network is available. Small split sizes may reduce performance.

split_time_period.title: File split time period (0 to 86400 seconds, 0 = disable)
split_time_period.description: Log file split time period in seconds relative to midnight (00:00:00). When a split time is reached a new file is created and the logging continues. Closed log files can be pushed to a server if network is available. Small split time periods may reduce performance.

split_time_offset.title: File split time offset (0 to 86400 seconds)
split_time_offset.description: Log file split time offset in seconds. This value offsets the split_time_period relative to midnight (00:00:00). The set value shall be less than the split_time_period value.

cyclic.title: Cyclic logging
cyclic.description: With cycling logging mode enabled the oldest log file is deleted when the memory card becomes full, allowing the logging to continue.

level.title: Level
level.description: Window size used during optional compression. Larger window sizes yield potentially better compression rates, but may reduce logging performance. Compressed log files need to be decompressed prior to processing.

state.title: State
state.description: Optional log file encryption. Encrypted log files need to be decrypted prior to processing. Decryption requires your encryption password in plain form - if this is lost, the encrypted data cannot be recovered.

keyformat.title: Key format
keyformat.description: The format of the encryption password used for encrypting logged data on the device.

pwd.description: Encryption password in plain form (min 1, max 64). Example: 2e9asdKJazCatsssdS323@ABCh22. IMPORTANT: Ensure that you securely store the plain form encryption password for decryption purposes.

Encryption password in encrypted form (min 24, max 108). Example: B1DlMrNh22tq/kNerK/T+eSyCWSJqiqyUoovQ7C6gqRaIng6F+E=. IMPORTANT: Ensure that you encrypt the encryption password and that you include the server public key. Further, ensure that you securely store the plain form encryption password for decryption purposes.

state.title: State
state.description: Specify whether to record error frames. Enabling this can negatively impact performance, as a potentially large number of additional frames may be recorded.

sync.title: Time synchronization method
sync.description: Internal real-time-clock synchronization method. The real-time-clock is maintained when the device is off.

oneOf.title: Retain current time
oneOf.description: The current internal time is not changed.

oneOf.title: Manual update
oneOf.description: The internal time is updated with the manually set UTC time when the device powers on. The manual time is set using the manual_date_time field

oneOf.title: CAN-bus
oneOf.description: The internal time synchronized to the time provided by the payload of a CAN-bus message

oneOf.title: Network
oneOf.description: The internal time is synchronized with the time provided by the network when available.

timezone.title: Time zone (UTC-12 to UTC+14)
timezone.description: Adjustment in full hours to the UTC time. Includes daylight savings time if applicable.

adjustment.title: Adjustment (-129600 to 129600 seconds)
adjustment.description: Adjustment in seconds to the UTC time. Can be used for fine tuning the internal time.

manual_date_time.title: Time (UTC)
manual_date_time.description: Manually set UTC date and time value.

ntp_server.title: Time server
ntp_server.description: NTP server name used for time synchronization. If the first character is an asterisk (*) then the server name is treated as a server pool. Examples:  *.pool.ntp.org, *.us.pool.ntp.org, time.nist.gov

secondaryport.title: Secondary Port
secondaryport.description: Control of power-out (5V) on Channel 2 (CH2) connector.

power_schedule.title: Power schedule
power_schedule.description: The daily power schedule is defined by a number of power-on from/to intervals. Define no power-on intervals to keep always off. Define one interval with from/to both set to 00:00 to keep always on. Time format is HH:MM (1 minute resolution)

from.title: From
from.description: Power-on FROM time in format HH:MM. Shall be before power-on TO time. E.g. at midnight 00:00

to.title: To
to.description: Power-on TO time in format HH:MM. Shall be after power-on FROM time. E.g. at midday 12:00.

can_internal.title: CAN Channel internal
can_internal.description: CAN Channel internal is a virtual channel used for signals generated by the device itself.

id.description: Filters are checked sequentially, execution stops with the first matching filter element. Max 20 filters in total.

can_1.title: CAN Channel 1 (physical)
can_1.description: CAN Channel 1 is an external physical channel.

can_2.title: CAN Channel 2 (physical)
can_2.description: CAN Channel 2 is an external physical channel.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: In station mode, the device can use either active or passive scanning to find APs. Using active scan, the radio transmits a probe request and listens for responses. Using passive scan, the radio listens on each channel for beacons sent periodically by APs.

keyformat.title: Key format
keyformat.description: The format of the key used for all entries in the access point list. Can be used to hide the WiFi passwords stored on the device.

accesspoint.title: Access points
accesspoint.description: List of access points. Connects to the first available AP in list.

ssid.title: SSID
ssid.description: Access point SSID (name of access point)

minrssi.title: Minimum RSSI (received signal strength indicator), 0-100%
minrssi.description: Sets a minimum required access point signal strength. The device will not connect to the access point if the measured signal strength is below the value of this field.

pwd.title: Password
pwd.description: Access point password in plain form (max 64). Leave empty to connect to an open AP. Example: 31aAabC81@99.

pwd.title: Encrypted password
pwd.description: Access point password in encrypted form (min 24, max 64). Example: rl8/EAy3qTChCsMIIeZPR6rvGEanRJCnL2xbzqo=. IMPORTANT: Ensure that you encrypt all access point passwords and that you include the server public key

sync.title: Synchronization
sync.description: This section configures how and when the device communicates with the S3 server.

ota.title: Firmware, config and certificate
ota.description: Configures how often the device looks for firmware-, config- and certificate-over-the-air updates. Small values may reduce performance. Time period may sometimes become longer if device is busy. Set to 0 to disable.

heartbeat.title: Heartbeat
heartbeat.description: Configures how often the device transmits the heartbeat signal. Small values may reduce performance. Time period may sometimes become longer if device is busy. Set to 0 to disable.

logfiles.title: Log files
logfiles.description: Configures if the device pushes closed log files to the server. The log files are deleted from the device when successfully uploaded.

server.title: Server
server.description: This section contains the server connection parameters.

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.description: S3 server endpoint. Prefix with http:// to connect using standard http. Prefix with https:// to connect using SSL/TLS - requires support by the server and that the server certificate is loaded onto the device. Examples: http://192.168.0.1, https://s3.mydomain.com, https://s3.amazonaws.com, http://s3-us-east-2.amazonaws.com.

bucket.title: Bucket name
bucket.description: S3 server bucket name. Examples: logbucket, fleetbucket, testbucket.

request_style.title: Request style
request_style.description: Virtual-hosted-style or path-style S3 requests. Virtual hosted-style format: "http://[BUCKET-NAME].[DOMAIN]/[OBJECT-NAME]". Path-style format: "http://[DOMAIN]/[BUCKET-NAME]/[OBJECT-NAME]"

accesskey.title: AccessKey
accesskey.description: S3 server access key ID. Example: PRDDKN8R6PAAOGTEI53E

keyformat.title: SecretKey format
keyformat.description: The format of the secret key. Can be used to hide the secret key stored on the device.

signed_payload.title: Signed payload
signed_payload.description: Include payload checksum in signature. Reduces device upload performance.

secretkey.description: S3 server secret key in plain form (max 128). Example: IAkwE9vvEh9ke4RH

S3 server secret key in encrypted form (min 24, max 150). Example: AKGaqGJWxEhTfJX6oeR/OIdu5Swm9HQY. IMPORTANT: Ensure that you correctly encrypt the secretKey and that you include the server public key
